item.title: Is Biking Better for the Environment?
item.description: I’ve biked to work almost every day for years, and during most of that time I figured I was doing the climate a big favor by not commuting by car. Recently, though, I had a worrisome thought. I’m not losing any weight, which means that the calories which power my bike are coming entirely from the food I eat. Now, it’s true that it takes less energy to power a bicycle than it does to power a car, but it’s also true that producing food energy can be more ecologically harmful than burning gasoline, at least from a carbon footprint standpoint.
